Class Ships

  • java.lang.Object
    • Ships

  • public class Ships
extends java.lang.Object
    Ships.java deals with ship placement, ship hit and colouring of the ships.
    Since:
    2019-07-06
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    munish

      • setupShip

        public void setupShip(java.lang.String start,
                      java.lang.String end)
        setupShip Function to setup a ship for Human Player.
        Parameters:
        start - is the starting location of the ship sent from UI.
        end - is the ending location of the ship sent from UI.

      • checkhit

        public static boolean checkhit(java.lang.String checkcordinate,
                               Player p)
        Function to check if a ship gets hit or not.
        Parameters:
        checkcordinate - is the location on which there is a hit done.
        p - is the player who's ship is to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if there is a hit on the ship else return false.

      • checkHitSalva

        public static java.lang.String checkHitSalva(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> hits,
                                             Player p)
        Return salva Hits/miss for the player
        Parameters:
        hits - String of random hits
        p - Player object
        Returns:
        String separated by "!", with hits/miss appended by ","

      • checkifship

        public static boolean checkifship(java.lang.String checkcordinate,
                                  Player p)
        Check if ship can placed for drag and drop
        Parameters:
        checkcordinate - String for the ship
        p - Player object for who ships are being placed
        Returns:
        true is co-ordinate is available for ship placement else false

      • colorButton

        public static boolean colorButton(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane G1,
                                  javafx.scene.layout.GridPane G2,
                                  java.lang.String S,
                                  Arena a,
                                  Player playerRef)
        Function to assign colours on the player grid: "RED"-if its a hit, "BLACK"-if its a miss.
        Parameters:
        G1 - Playing grid of the opposite player.
        G2 - Reference grid for the player who made the hit.
        S - location of the grid to be checked.
        a - object of class Arena.
        playerRef - object of the opposite player.
        Returns:
        true if its hit else return false.
